required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-Center Study of New Medications to Treat Vaginal Infections
clinical_study.official_title: Solubilized Metronidazole And/oR Terconazole Gels Intra-Vaginal Efficacy and Safety

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of terconazole gel in the treatment of vaginal infections

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Cure as Assessed by the Investigator at the Test-of-cure Visit
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with clinical cure in each arm was compared. A clinical cure is defined as the resolution of all signs and symptoms attributable to vulvovaginal candidiasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement/Cure of Individual and Cumulative Signs, Symptoms and Criteria for the Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Signs (edema, erythema, excoriation) and symptoms (itching, burning irritation) were each scored as absent (0), mild (1), moderate (2) or severe (3). A total sign score of 0-9 and total symptom score of 0-9 were combined for a total possible combined sign and symptom score of 0-18. Total median combined sign and symptom severity score was compared between arms at the test of cure visit. Lower scores at day 7-14 indicate improvement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7-14 days after beginning treatment and at 21-30 days after beginning treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Vaginal swabs were cultured for Candida species in a laboratory. A positive culture indicates presence of vaginal yeast and a negative culture indicates absence of vaginal yeast. A negative culture indicates mycologic cure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Complete Resolution of Symptoms by Test of Cure Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects reported if symptoms completely resolved and the date of resolution. The percentage of participants reporting complete resolution of symptoms was compared between arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Any time during study participation (up to 30 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events were collected at study visits, from subject diaries and from spontaneous reports

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A clinical diagnosis of vaginal infection that is confirmed by laboratory testing and:
- Capable of providing written informed consent or assent
- Currently not menstruating and not anticipating menses during treatment
- If heterosexually active, subject must be post-menopausal for â‰¥ 1 year, surgically sterile, or practicing an acceptable form of birth control
- Negative pregnancy test
- Other criteria as identified in the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other infectious causes of vulvovaginitis
- Subject has recently used, or is expected to require the concomitant use of prohibited medications/products
- Nursing mother
- Use of any investigational drug within 30 days of enrollment
- History of hypersensitivity to any ingredient/component of the formulations
- Other criteria as identified in the protocol

facility.name: R. Garn Mabey Jr., MD Gynecology

group.title: Terconazole Vaginal Gel
group.description: One applicator full at bedtime Terconazole

group.title: Gel Vehicle
group.description: One applicator full at bedtime Placebo

baseline.population: modified intent-to-treat (mITT) population includes all subjects randomized to treatment and administered at least one dose of study drug. In addition, subjects must have a positive baseline vaginal fungal culture for Candida species.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected over the entire course of the study (up to 30 days after beginning treatment).
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were collected through direct questioning at each post-baseline visit, by participant diaries, and by spontaneous reporting. The safety population includes all participants randomized to treatment and administered at least one dose of study drug, and includes subjects who had a negative yeast culture at the baseline visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Investigators have the right to disclose and publish results of the Study conducted by them; provided that, in order to protect any Sponsor confidential information, Investigator shall submit to Sponsor manuscripts at least 30 days before submission for publication or 10 days before public presentation. After that time, Investigator is free to submit the manuscript for publication or deliver the presentation, provided Investigator removes any confidential information as directed by Sponsor.
